https://doi.org/10.7927/H4WM1BB7.Description: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) Socio-Economic Baseline Dataset consists of population, human development, economic, water resources, land cover, land use, agriculture, food, energy, and biodiversity data. This dataset was collated by IPCC from a variety of sources such as The World Bank, United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), and Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) and is distributed by the Columbia University Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN).
https://doi.org/10.7927/H4WM1BB7.Project: IPCC - Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change

https://doi.org/10.7927/yzp7-sm30.Description: The INFORM (Index for Risk Management) Global Risk Index includes overall risk of humanitarian crisis based on hazard exposure, vulnerability, and lack of coping capacity. These data can aid in disaster preparation and resource allocation.

https://doi.org/10.7927/5bbs-e174.Description: The Natural Resource Protection and Child Health Indicators show the average of three proximity-to-target scores for access to at least basic water and sanitation, along with child mortality.

https://doi.org/10.7927/k9t6-gh59.Description: The Global Development Potential Indices (GDPI) dataset provides Development Potential Indices (DPIs) for various sectors related to renewable energy, fossil fuels, mining, and agriculture. These indices may aid in conservation priority setting.

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4K64G12.Description: The Global Subnational Prevalence of Child Malnutrition dataset shows the percentage of underweight children in the world. These data may be useful in food insecurity and malnutrition research.

https://dx.doi.org/10.7927/H45X26V8.Description: The Poverty Mapping Project: Unsatisfied Basic Needs dataset shows household well-being and access to basic needs such as housing conditions, water, electricity, sanitation, education, and employment for various countries in Latin America. These data are useful in poverty, inequality, and environmental research.
https://dx.doi.org/10.7927/H45X26V8.Geographic_Coverage: Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, Mexico, Nicaragua, Peru

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4PZ56R2.Description: The Global Subnational Infant Mortality Rates and the Poverty Mapping data provide a map of infant mortality rates. These data are useful in tracking environmental justice concerns in healthcare and air quality.

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4FF3Q9B.Description: The Poverty and Food Security Case Studies dataset provides subnational estimates of poverty, inequality, food security, and related measures for administrative areas in Mexico, Ecuador, Kenya, Malawi, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nigeria, and Vietnam. These data may be useful in food security and poverty research.
https://doi.org/10.7927/H4FF3Q9B.Geographic_Coverage: Mexico, Ecuador, Kenya, Malawi, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Nigeria, Vietnam

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4HQ3WTH.Description: The Global 15 x 15 Minute Grids of the Downscaled Population Based on the SRES B2 Scenario dataset provides gridded data on country-level population and downscaled projections. These data may aid in urbanization research and urban environmental justice.

https://doi.org/10.7927/H4XW4GQ1.Description: The Country-Level GDP and Downscaled Projections dataset provides data on country-level GDP per capita and downscaled projections based on the SRES A1, A2, B1, B2 marker scenarios. These data may be useful in food availability research.
https://doi.org/10.7927/H4XW4GQ1.Project: PDP - Projections of Future Economic and Population Scenarios
